definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Going blind was the watershed of my life.
sentences.chinese: 失明成为我人生的一个分水岭。

sentences.english: Watershed infarcts have a characteristic distribution in the brain.
sentences.chinese: 脑部分水岭梗塞有其特征性的分布区域。

sentences.english: To the life of the watershed, and in the test with the experience and to grasp.
sentences.chinese: 到了人生的分水岭了，在考验与历练中去把握。

sentences.english: The Cheng Nan-jung self-immolation incident is a watershed in Taiwan's political movement.
sentences.chinese: 郑南榕的自焚事件，是台湾政治运动的分水岭。

sentences.english: It was a watershed in the ghetto's history .
sentences.chinese: 是黑人区历史的分水岭。

sentences.english: This must be a watershed event, with a clear before and after.
sentences.chinese: 本次会议必须成为一个前后带有明显差别的分水岭。

sentences.english: IRN supports local communities working to protect their rivers and watersheds.
sentences.chinese: IRN支持当地居民去保房他们的河流和分水岭。

sentences.english: Yanhe River watershed, and show nearly East-West from the integration of areas in the central passage.
sentences.chinese: 南河与秀延河分水岭近东西向从整合区中部通过。

sentences.english: Therefore, said Mira Hill is a continental climate with the climate of the watershed.
sentences.chinese: 因此说，米拉山是大陆性气候与海洋性气候的分水岭。

sentences.english: The great divide which separates rationalism from superstition.
sentences.chinese: 把理性主义与迷信相区别的分水岭。

sentences.english: Therefore , said Mira Hill is a continental climate with the climate of the watershed . bbs. ifeng…
sentences.chinese: 因此说，米拉山是大陆性气候与海洋性气候的分水岭。

sentences.english: I always experienced the beginning of a new school year as a watershed.
sentences.chinese: 我总是感觉新学年的开始是个分水岭。

sentences.english: It forms the watershed between the two rivers.
sentences.chinese: 它成了两条河流的分水岭。

sentences.english: There's no dividing line with machine languages on one side and all the high-level languages on the other.
sentences.chinese: 并没有一个位于机器语言和高级语言之间的分水岭。

sentences.english: About one third of the park lies on the west side of the divide.
sentences.chinese: 大约该公园的三分之一面积位于分水岭的西部。

sentences.english: So this is the big continental divide for the course.
sentences.chinese: 这里就是这个课程的大分水岭。

definition: turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
(fig.) gulf/chasm/wide gap/(originally) the Hong Canal in Henan, which in ancient times formed the border between enemies Chu 楚 and Han 漢|汉
the road one must follow or take/the only way/same as 必由之路[bi4 you2 zhi1 lu4]
shift in the trend of events/turnaround/plot shift in a book/turn in the conversation
to stride toward (success)/to march toward/to take a step toward
